title: ISic030298. Entella 5 = A1, Entella thanks those who helped in the synoikismos
body:
1ἐπὶ ἀρχόντων
2Ἀρτεμιδώρου
3Εἰέλου καὶ Γναίου
4Ὀππίου Πανάμου
5νεμηνίαι
6ἐπειδή τινες τᾶμ πολίων ἐς τὸν συνοικισμὸν
7τᾶς πόλιος σίτωι ἐβοαθ̣όησαν οἱ μὲγ καὶ ἔδωκαν
8δωρεὰν τᾶι πόλι οἱ δὲ καὶ ἐμέτρησαν καὶ ἔδει-
9ξαμ μεγάλαν εὔνοιαν εἰς τὸν δᾶμον τῶν Ἐν-
10τελλίνων καὶ ἀντὶ ἐνδείας σίτου εὐετηρίαν ἐπό-
11ησαν ἔδο̣ξ̣ε τᾶι βουλᾶι ὅσσαι ἐβοαθόησαν τᾶμ πολί-
12ων σίτωι ἤ̣ χρήμ̣ατι ἤ ἄλλωι τινὶ ἐς τὸν συνοικισμὸν
13τᾶς πόλιο<ς> εἴμειν αὐτοῖς εὔν[ο]ιαγ καὶ ἰσοπολιτείαμ πο̣-
14τὶ τὸν δᾶμον τῶ̣ν Ἐν̣τελλίνων κατὰ παντὸς χρόνου καὶ
15κατακαλεῖσθ̣αι ἐς το̣ὺς ἀγῶνας καὶ τὰμ προεδρίαν καὶ ἰδι-
16ώτας δὲ τοὺς εσ[. 6.]υ̣σαντας τᾶι πόλι σίτωι ἐς τὸν συν-
17οικισμὸ̣ν εἴμειν α̣ὐτ̣ο̣ὺς προξένους τᾶς πόλ̣ιος τῶν Ἐντελ-
18λίνων̣ καὶ αὐτοὺς καὶ τὰ τέκνα αὐτῶν ἔδοξε καὶ τᾶι ἁλί-
19αι Πετρίνων τὸ̣ κοινὸν ἐμέτρησε σπυρῶν ´ μεδίμνο̣υς̣
20Κυτατταρ̣ιν̣ί[ω]ν τὸ̣ κοινὸν ἔδωκε δωρεὰν σπυρῶν ´ κρι-
21θᾶν ´ τᾶμ̣ Σχερ̣ίνων ἔδωκε δωρ̣εὰν τὸ κοινὸν σπυρῶν
22 ´ κριθᾶν ´ Μ̣ακελλίνων τὸ κοινὸν ἐμέτρησε σπυ-
23ρ̣ῶν #greek-acrophonic-entella-hundred´ μεδίμνο̣υς ἰδιῶται δὲ Πετρῖνοι οἱ μετρήσαντες
24ο̣ἵ̣δε Θεόδωρος Πράτωνος Σάννειος σπυρῶν ´
25Αἰσχυλὸ̣ς Πράτωνος Σάννειος σπυρῶν ´ Ἡρά-
26κλειος Ἡρακλείδα σπυρῶν ´ Ἀρίμναστος Σίμου ´
27Σώσανδρος Ἀρίστωνος σπυρῶν ´ Μίνατος Κόρουιος
28Μαμερτῖνος κριθᾶν ´ τὸ δὲ ἁλίασμα τοῦτο οἱ ἄρ-
29χοντες γράψαντες ἐς χάλκωμα ἀναθέντω ἐς τὸ
30βουλευτήριον

l.13 ς

30ΒΟΥΛΕΥΤΗΡΙΟΝ

l.13 ς

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text by Prag based upon photographs;
  • 3: Asheri-Nenci 82, Dubois 89, Nenci 91: Γναί<ου>ου (after Lejeune, ASNP 1982, p.792-94; contra Daux 84, p.393)
  • 4: Lewis 78: °ππίου · Πανάμουο; Nenci 80: ἱππίου · Πανάμου; Asheri-Nenci 82 app.crit.: (wrongly) ascribes reading Ἱππίου to Anglicus interpres
  • 13: other edd.: πόλιος; SEG 30: πο- omitted
  • 14: Lewis 78, Nenci 80, SEG 30: κατ ἅπαντος
  • 15: other edd.: κατακαλεῖσθαι ἐς τ[ο]ὺς
  • 16: Lewis 78: ἐξι.ατ.ήσαντας (transl: ‘assisted? (word undeciphered)’); Nenci 80: ἐξ̣̣ι.ατ.ήσανταν; SEG 30: ἐξι.ατ.ήσαντας; Asheri-Nenci 82, Dubois 89, Nenci 91, Nenci 93: ἐξυ[πηρε]τήσαντας; Lombardo 97, p.1039: ἐπ̣ι̣β̣ο̣α̣θ̣ο̣ήσαντας; Porciani 01: ἐξυ̣[πηρε]τ̣ή̣σαντας; Ampolo et al. 2001, Souza 24: ἐσβ̣ο̣αθ̣ο̣ήσαντας
  • 17: Lewis 78, Nenci 80, SEG 30, Asheri-Nenci 82, Dubois 89: ικισμ[ὸ]ν; Nenci 91, Nenci 93: ικισμὸ̣ν
  • 18: Dubois 89: -λίων
  • 19: Variant form of the numerals in Nenci 80, SEG 30, Asheri-Nenci 82, Dubois 89; significant variation Lombardo 97, p.1042
  • 20: Lewis 78, Nenci 80, SEG 30, Asheri-Nenci 82, Dubois 89, Nenci 91, Nenci 93: τ[ὸ]; slightly variant form of the second numeral in Nenci 80, SEG 30, Asheri-Nenci 82, Dubois 89
  • 21: Lewis 78, Nenci 80, SEG 30, Asheri-Nenci 82, Dubois 89: Ταυ̣α̣ι̣σχεηνων; Manganaro 90, p.400 n.41: τῶ̣ν̣ δ̣ὲ̣ Σχερ̣ί̣νων (after Bejor, ASNP 1982, p.834); Nenci 91, 93: τᾶμ Σχηρίνων; Lombardo 97, p.1040-42: ἡπτα (num) Σχερίνων (misreported by SEG 47.1419); BE 106 (1993), 717 (Dubois): Ταμσχεήνων; the numeral also varies across these readings
  • 22: Nenci 91, Nenci 93: χριθᾶν
  • 23: Lewis 78, Nenci 80, SEG 30, Nenci 91: numeral as H; Asheri-Nenci 82, Nenci 93: numeral omitted (Nenci 83, p.1001 states omitted in error, H to be read; cf. SEG 32, 914); Dubois 89: H with double bar; Lombardo 97, p.1043: aporia; Porciani 01: [.]
  • 24: Porciani 01: Θεώδωρος
  • 25: Lewis 78: Αἰσχύλ[ο]ς; Nenci 80, SEG 30: Αἰσχύ[ο]ς; Asheri-Nenci 82, Dubois 89, Daux 84, p.393: Αἰσχύ[λο]ς; Asheri-Nenci 82, app.crit. reports: ‘Αἰσχύ]ο[ς Angl. interp.’; Porciano 01, Souza 24: Αἰσχυλὶς; Slightly variant form of third numeral in SEG 30, Asheri-Nenci 82, Dubois 89
  • 26: Slightly variant form of the numerals in Lewis 78, Nenci 80, SEG 30, Asheri-Nenci 82, Dubois 89
  • 27: Slightly variant form of the numeral in Lewis 78, Nenci 80, SEG 30, Asheri-Nenci 82, Dubois 89; Asheri-Nenci 82, Dubois 89, Nenci 91, Nenci 93: Κορ<ό>ουιος (after Lejeune, ASNP 1982, p.792-94)
  • 28: Slightly variant form of the second numeral in Nenci 91, Nenci 93
  • 29: Lewis 78, Nenci 80, SEG 30, Asheri-Nenci 82, Dubois 89, Nenci 91, Nenci 93: ἐσγράψαντες (corrected by Lombardo 97, p.1040).

English translation

Jonathan Prag

In the archonship of Artemidoros son of Eielos and Gnaios Oppios, on the new moon of Panamos. Since some of the cities have come to the help of the synoikismos of the city with corn, some having given it to the city as a free gift and some having made it available, and have shown great good will to the people of Entella and have created abundance of corn instead of dearth, resolved by the Council that all those of the cities that have helped the synoikismos of the city with corn or money or anything else are to enjoy good will and equal citizenship with the people of Entella for all time and they shall be invited to the games and to the front seats, and those individuals who have assisted the city with corn for the synoikismos shall be proxenoi of the city of Entella, themselves and their children. Resolved also by the Assembly. The community of the Petrinoi made available 201 medimnoi of wheat. The community of the Kutattarinioi gave as a gift of wheat 60, of barley 51. The community of the Scherinoi(?) gave as a gift of wheat 30, of barley 30. The community of the Makellinoi made available 100 medimnoi of wheat. And the private citizens of the Petrinoi who made corn available were these: Theodoros son of Praton the Sanneian of wheat 150; Aischylos son of Praton the Sanneian of wheat 120; Herakleios son of Herakleidas of wheat 100; Arimnastos son of Simos 50; Sosandros son of Ariston of wheat 50; Minatos Corvios the Mamertine of barley 30. The archons are to write this decree on a bronze plaque and exhibit it in the council-chamber.

Italian translation

Jonathan Prag

commentary

The text of Lewis was at least partially based upon photographs taken pre-cleaning; and the initial texts of Nenci / Nenci and Asheri were derivative of Lewis' original transcription. The bibliography is intended to cover principal editions only. For a recent historical discussion, elucidating the First Punic War context, see Lombardo, Mario. 2018. «Entella tra i Cartaginesi e i Romani, ovvero da chi erano stati espulsi gli Entellini». In Munus Laetitiae. Studi miscellanei offerti a Maria Letizia Lazzarini, a cura di Francesco Camia, Lavinio Del Monaco, e Michela Nocita, 2:485–98. Rome: Sapienza Universita Editrice. https://doi.org/10.13133/9788893770736; and now Souza 2024.

Apparatus criticus

  • Text by Prag based upon photographs;
  • 3: Asheri-Nenci 82, Dubois 89, Nenci 91: Γναί<ου>ου (after Lejeune, ASNP 1982, p.792-94; contra Daux 84, p.393)
  • 4: Lewis 78: °ππίου · Πανάμουο; Nenci 80: ἱππίου · Πανάμου; Asheri-Nenci 82 app.crit.: (wrongly) ascribes reading Ἱππίου to Anglicus interpres
  • 13: other edd.: πόλιος; SEG 30: πο- omitted
  • 14: Lewis 78, Nenci 80, SEG 30: κατ ἅπαντος
  • 15: other edd.: κατακαλεῖσθαι ἐς τ[ο]ὺς
  • 16: Lewis 78: ἐξι.ατ.ήσαντας (transl: ‘assisted? (word undeciphered)’); Nenci 80: ἐξ̣̣ι.ατ.ήσανταν; SEG 30: ἐξι.ατ.ήσαντας; Asheri-Nenci 82, Dubois 89, Nenci 91, Nenci 93: ἐξυ[πηρε]τήσαντας; Lombardo 97, p.1039: ἐπ̣ι̣β̣ο̣α̣θ̣ο̣ήσαντας; Porciani 01: ἐξυ̣[πηρε]τ̣ή̣σαντας; Ampolo et al. 2001, Souza 24: ἐσβ̣ο̣αθ̣ο̣ήσαντας
  • 17: Lewis 78, Nenci 80, SEG 30, Asheri-Nenci 82, Dubois 89: ικισμ[ὸ]ν; Nenci 91, Nenci 93: ικισμὸ̣ν
  • 18: Dubois 89: -λίων
  • 19: Variant form of the numerals in Nenci 80, SEG 30, Asheri-Nenci 82, Dubois 89; significant variation Lombardo 97, p.1042
  • 20: Lewis 78, Nenci 80, SEG 30, Asheri-Nenci 82, Dubois 89, Nenci 91, Nenci 93: τ[ὸ]; slightly variant form of the second numeral in Nenci 80, SEG 30, Asheri-Nenci 82, Dubois 89
  • 21: Lewis 78, Nenci 80, SEG 30, Asheri-Nenci 82, Dubois 89: Ταυ̣α̣ι̣σχεηνων; Manganaro 90, p.400 n.41: τῶ̣ν̣ δ̣ὲ̣ Σχερ̣ί̣νων (after Bejor, ASNP 1982, p.834); Nenci 91, 93: τᾶμ Σχηρίνων; Lombardo 97, p.1040-42: ἡπτα (num) Σχερίνων (misreported by SEG 47.1419); BE 106 (1993), 717 (Dubois): Ταμσχεήνων; the numeral also varies across these readings
  • 22: Nenci 91, Nenci 93: χριθᾶν
  • 23: Lewis 78, Nenci 80, SEG 30, Nenci 91: numeral as H; Asheri-Nenci 82, Nenci 93: numeral omitted (Nenci 83, p.1001 states omitted in error, H to be read; cf. SEG 32, 914); Dubois 89: H with double bar; Lombardo 97, p.1043: aporia; Porciani 01: [.]
  • 24: Porciani 01: Θεώδωρος
  • 25: Lewis 78: Αἰσχύλ[ο]ς; Nenci 80, SEG 30: Αἰσχύ[ο]ς; Asheri-Nenci 82, Dubois 89, Daux 84, p.393: Αἰσχύ[λο]ς; Asheri-Nenci 82, app.crit. reports: ‘Αἰσχύ]ο[ς Angl. interp.’; Porciano 01, Souza 24: Αἰσχυλὶς; Slightly variant form of third numeral in SEG 30, Asheri-Nenci 82, Dubois 89
  • 26: Slightly variant form of the numerals in Lewis 78, Nenci 80, SEG 30, Asheri-Nenci 82, Dubois 89
  • 27: Slightly variant form of the numeral in Lewis 78, Nenci 80, SEG 30, Asheri-Nenci 82, Dubois 89; Asheri-Nenci 82, Dubois 89, Nenci 91, Nenci 93: Κορ<ό>ουιος (after Lejeune, ASNP 1982, p.792-94)
  • 28: Slightly variant form of the second numeral in Nenci 91, Nenci 93
  • 29: Lewis 78, Nenci 80, SEG 30, Asheri-Nenci 82, Dubois 89, Nenci 91, Nenci 93: ἐσγράψαντες (corrected by Lombardo 97, p.1040).

English translation

Jonathan Prag

In the archonship of Artemidoros son of Eielos and Gnaios Oppios, on the new moon of Panamos. Since some of the cities have come to the help of the synoikismos of the city with corn, some having given it to the city as a free gift and some having made it available, and have shown great good will to the people of Entella and have created abundance of corn instead of dearth, resolved by the Council that all those of the cities that have helped the synoikismos of the city with corn or money or anything else are to enjoy good will and equal citizenship with the people of Entella for all time and they shall be invited to the games and to the front seats, and those individuals who have assisted the city with corn for the synoikismos shall be proxenoi of the city of Entella, themselves and their children. Resolved also by the Assembly. The community of the Petrinoi made available 201 medimnoi of wheat. The community of the Kutattarinioi gave as a gift of wheat 60, of barley 51. The community of the Scherinoi(?) gave as a gift of wheat 30, of barley 30. The community of the Makellinoi made available 100 medimnoi of wheat. And the private citizens of the Petrinoi who made corn available were these: Theodoros son of Praton the Sanneian of wheat 150; Aischylos son of Praton the Sanneian of wheat 120; Herakleios son of Herakleidas of wheat 100; Arimnastos son of Simos 50; Sosandros son of Ariston of wheat 50; Minatos Corvios the Mamertine of barley 30. The archons are to write this decree on a bronze plaque and exhibit it in the council-chamber.

commentary

The text of Lewis was at least partially based upon photographs taken pre-cleaning; and the initial texts of Nenci / Nenci and Asheri were derivative of Lewis' original transcription. The bibliography is intended to cover principal editions only. For a recent historical discussion, elucidating the First Punic War context, see Lombardo, Mario. 2018. «Entella tra i Cartaginesi e i Romani, ovvero da chi erano stati espulsi gli Entellini». In Munus Laetitiae. Studi miscellanei offerti a Maria Letizia Lazzarini, a cura di Francesco Camia, Lavinio Del Monaco, e Michela Nocita, 2:485–98. Rome: Sapienza Universita Editrice. https://doi.org/10.13133/9788893770736; and now Souza 2024.
